text: this is a drug bust about 300 nautical
miles off Costa Rica
the recording is part of a federal drug
smuggling case in New York City which
somewhat improbable raise the question
of what it means to fly a flag it was
June 2015 US Coast Guard officers came
alongside and boarded this skiff known
as a go-fast one man hung on the boats
side he was pulled up and cuffed two
others lay facedown on the boats
floorboards Coast Guard officers
discovered a trove of cocaine with an
estimated street value of 20 million
dollars the authorities say the men
described by their lawyers as poor
Ecuadorian fisherman have each pleaded
not guilty to drug related charges on
the high seas and their lawyers argue
the case should be dismissed but the
government said that under US law a
vessel at sea that is not flying a
nation's flag is considered stateless
and is subject to United States
jurisdiction and therefore the Coast
Guard could board the vessel but the
men's lawyers disagreed they argued that
right here painted on the boats hull is
a tiny Ecuadorian flag and they said the
Coast Guard should never have boarded
the vessel thus whether a tiny flag
painted on the side of the boat is the
same as flying a flag became a crucial
issue in the case prosecutors are
quoting dictionary definitions of flag
flying like to move around in the air
while being held at one end and to float
wave or soar in the air and they've even
cited the lyrics of this George Cohan
favorite
the judge ultimately ruled that the flag
was not large or prominent enough to
identify to go fast as an Ecuadorian
flagged vessel bottom line the boat was
stateless and could be boarded by US
authorities for the men the stakes
remain high if convicted that could face
up to life in prison
